reviewText: I've never been disappointed with a Raviana DVD, and I have all of them. This is no exception.It strengthens the legs with a couple of wide angle squats on your toes. It builds lots of endurance in the upper body, holding arm extensions, and arm circles.You're encouraged to become aware of negative feelings so you can uproot them. The positive encouragement and soothing music makes you willing to go inside to those less than comfortable psychic spaces.Every recommended movement is pretty safe for a beginner and it's still a good workout.Don't miss the extra set after the final credits.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a HUGE fan of Ana Brett and Ravi Singh's, so when I heard there were new DVDs coming, I was eager to pre-order.  The Kundalini Yoga Transformer was one of the DVDs I pre-ordered and anxiously awaited its arrival.This DVD's purpose is to transform negative events in your life into positive growth.  As Ana states (and I paraphrase), the things that have happened to us in the past may not have been our fault, but they do become our responsibility.  Doing this DVD is taking your responsibility seriously and getting rid of anger, and negative baggage.Well... the first two times I did it, I felt very anxious afterward, so I wrote to Ana and Ravi and asked them what this meant.  They replied quickly: "What you have been experiencing as a result of doing the Transformer DVD is no doubt residual "stuff," being processed out. Please be assured that this is only temporary and that you will lighter and healthier for your effort. It is far better to deal with old stress and emotions in a controlled fashion, even though it may involve a little bit of discomfort, than to have it compromise our lives or health later on."I continued doing the Transformer DVD (and will continue doing so to complete a 40 day cycle), and I am so glad I did! One week later, I began to feel completely different.  More at peace - and the exercises are becoming easier for me, too.I wrote to Ana and Ravi again to thank them for their recommendations and let them know about my experience.  They were kind enough to respond again with the following.: "We are so happy to hear that you are getting good results with Kundalini Yoga Transformer! Joseph Campbell said that to exist is to be in process. Sometimes Kundalini Yoga gives us the gift of letting us see what had been buried as it is being processed out. In psychotherapy, this is known as "retracing." We feel it is important for people to understand that a little bit of discomfort in the context of work on oneself can actually be a good thing!"I wholeheartedly recommend the purchase of this DVD.  I have a collection of over 20 Kundalini Yoga DVDs and have been practicing for years - this one is STILL a standout.Sat Nam Everyone.
Title: N/A

reviewText: You don't read those two words in the same sentence very often (emotional, yoga) but this incredibly profound DVD consists of not only a complete, full body workout, but it also goes deep and helps to resolve all of those junky patterns which cause all of us so much pain and suffering. And it's all done in such a graceful, dare I say, fun, way! I'm not being glib when I say that you can go to a therapist and talk for years (because I've done it!)and maybe get some clarity, but really walk out no different. I've made more progress with my ability to feel happy and good about myself with this DVD than I have with anything else I've tried. The Born Free segment (for one) is awesome. I'm so excited to tell everyone I know about this. Words just don't do this justice, but I hope my words inspire you to try this!

You will feel refreshed and renewed. Ravi and Ana are just Gems at knowing the right squences together and each Dvd always has fun new moves. What can I say "Buy it now you wont be dissapointed". reviewText: Here is another wonderful DVD from Raviana. This is so helpful in moving on from past habits and feelings and achieving fulfillment. It is a great workout both in mind and body! Ana and Ravi have really outdone themselves in their three new DVDs. I am so impressed with each of them. I chose the title for this review as "take it to the next level and be transformed", because I feel after doing this DVD it has taken me to a new level in my body, life, and mind. The exercises are challenging, yet doable and satisfying. While working your body you are also working your mind and healing your emotions. It works on all levels, so you can really feel and be transformed to be wholly you. The background music is beautiful chants mostly and nice instrumentals as well. I also really like all of Ana's outfits in these three new DVDs. Ana looks incredible and glows, which gives a wonderful motivation for doing the exercises, because she is showing by example that these exercises work. I don't think anyone would be disappointed in buying this. It's an incredible DVD.Here are the details, in case some of you want to know just what is on the DVD.There are PRE-SETS:GETTING STARTED: 56 min.INTERMEDIATE WORKOUT: 54 min.QUICK UPLIFT: 40 min.TRANSFORMER EXPRESS: 40 min.TRANSFORMER EXPRESS 2: 35 min.TUNING IN first of course: chanting "ong namo guru dev namo"WARM-UPS: 10 minutesseated spinal grinds, spinal flexes, twisting with arms up and parallel, rag doll exercise(seated forward bend bringing alternate legs into the thigh and leaning forward), then bending over one leg with Breath of Fire(rapid breath through nose), then lying on your back for one minute.TRANSFORMER PART 1: 9 minutes 30 secondsyou start standing with feet hip width apart, toes facing out, heels raised. you maintain this posture while doing hand movements. then you come seated doing a spinal flex but also with the neck moving forward and back. Then, staying seated, you do arm movements while saying "Har". Next you lie on your back and raise the legs 6 inches off the floor and hold doing Long Deep Breathing.TRANSFORMER PART 2: 8 minuteslying on back, ankles crossed, you raise and lower your legs. Then, still lying on your back, you sit up but keep your legs on the floor(you only raise your upper body), then you sit up with your legs bent and arms behind you and lift your hips up and down. Then you stay in the up position with Long Deep Breathing through an open mouth, then with Breath of Fire panting through an open mouth. Next you sit with your arms rounded overhead, thumbs thumbprint to thumbprint.BORN FREE: 16 minutes 30 secondsseated, you are circling your arms with hands in rigid claws. You are circling them around each side of your head. You are inhaling through puckered lips and exhaling through the nose. Then you do the previous exercise from the Transformer Part 2(the arms rounded overhead one).DEEP RELAXATION: 4 minutes 22 secondsso peaceful and healing!BEAUTIFUL GOBINDAY CHANT: 5 minutes 50 secondsthis chant is beautiful to do. Mantras really do something special. When I first started yoga, I skipped the mantras, but after trying them I realized they do a special work that is very important. The sounds vibrate certain places in the body and welcome transformation in your life.There is then the CLOSING PRAYER(1 min. 11 sec.)There is also a BREATH PRIMER(5 min. 30 sec.)Also, PURIFY YOUR PAST segment (9 min. 50 sec.):your hands are together in prayer pose with the heels of the hands at the naval. You move your hands up and down rapidly. Then you extend your arms straight out to your sides parallel to the floor, palms facing up, doing the Breath of Fire. Then you tilt your head back and do Long Deep Breathing through an open mouth. Next head back to normal with Long Deep Breathing. Then you sit quietly. The words Ravi speaks throughout this are so amazing. It brings past habits, hurts, and issues to the front to be dealt with and healed. I think this meditation will help so many people come to terms and be free of the past.
summary: take it to the next level and be transformed

reviewText: Yoga , to me, is about movement, freeing energy flows in my body, getting centered, and quieting my mind chatter.  Any of Ana & Ravis DVDs do this perfectly but Transformer takes it to a whole other level! The exercises are easy to do but challenging and you will work areas of the body you don't usually work to get into "the pain of the past" and purify it. I feel like I had a year of pschycotherapy after I am done - blissed and free!I would highly recommend this DVD to anyone of any level wanting an energizing and effective practice.What is continually amazing to me? In spite of making at least 20 Kundalini yoga DVDs, Ravi and Ana manage to come up with new sets!

reviewText: Ana Brett & Ravi Singh seem to have the genius ability to create complete workouts which fuse tradition and innovation and amplify Spirit thru their excellent DVD's. They have sussed out exactly what people in our life and times need, and have given us fun and exciting ways to fill that need. This is a whole body workout which delves deep and turns your exercise time into a life changing experience. Each time I do this I feel lighter and better about myself. I also feel stronger, more relaxed, and more focused and inspired!
summary: A True A+  of a Yoga Tape!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This review is from: Kundalini Yoga Transformer All-In-One Workout ALL LEVELS [DVD] (DVD)Transform your body!Feed your soul!Change your life!This is Kundalini Yoga with Ana and Ravi! different to other forms of yoga that you may have experienced! I had practiced Hatha yoga (a beautiful practice) for over a year before I discovered Kundalini Yoga. I soon realised that Kundalini was what I had been waiting for, I resonate with it completely and have been working regularly in the mornings with Kundalini Yoga for over a year....I look forward to it every day!So on with the review.The production of the DVD is of high quality. The setting is visually pleasing with images of the sea and greenery in the background, there is a buddha, lotus flowers and nice spacious area where Ana demonstrates the class. The sound quality is good and the music uplifting and inspiring......I like it.You have many options with this DVD and this includes a 'Breath Primer' that you will find in the Chapter selections, this is especially good if you are new to Kundalini Yoga as you will be taught the long deep breathing and the 'breath of fire' which are used during the class.You can design your own workout, which is great if you are restricted by time etc, with the 'matrix' menu options. If you don't know how to use the 'matrix' then there is a tutorial section which you access from the main menu. Ana and Ravi have prepared some 'pre sets' that you can work with which are: Getting Started 56 mins, Intermediate workout 54 mins, Quick uplift 40 mins, Tranformer express 40 mins, Transformer express 35 mins. Or you can play the DVD through which is another great option!The Class includes:Introduction 1.20Start the Class via 'Tune in' chanting the mantra 'Ong Namo Guru Dev Namo' three times to some lovely music..nice 2.00Warm ups to prepare for what comes next and include Sufi grind and Ragdoll 10.00Transformer Part 1 9.30IncludesStanding with legs apart on balls of feet and arms outstretched with hands in fists thumbs pointing out. Move thumbs forward, middle, back...repeating with Breath of fireSame postition as above move thumbs to touch the shoulders and then stretch arms out working with the breathSit in easy pose and work with spine flex variationsSit in easy pose work with arms to shoulders whilst chanting the mantra 'Har'Lie on back and relaxLie on back raise heels off the floor with long deep breathing (modification given)Transformer Part 2 8.00Lie on back, cross ankles and do double leg lifts, working with the breath (modification given)Relax on backLie on back, arms raised inhale to sit up and exhale to lie back (modification given)Relax on backRock on spineSit up feet flat and knees bent, hands behind the hips..inhale up into bridge type pose and exhale down with further variations..stay in up position and open mouth breathing long and deep...extend tongue and do panting breath like breath of fire (i really enjoyed this, it felt wonderful)Easy pose meditationEasy pose, hands interlaced with thumbs touching above head in a mudra, long deep breathingBORN FREE! 16.00Easy pose with hands in rigid claws, arms bent at elbows and circle the hands at temple level. Breath in through puckered lips and out through the nose. Breath long and smooth. This was absoulutely wonderful, I didn't think that I would be able to keep going but somehow my arms began to feel lighter and I went on...it was just wonderful!Easy pose hands interlaced with thumbs meeting and above the head, inhale through puckered lips and exhale through the nose............beautiful, blissful!Deep Relaxation, lying down on back and guided by Ravi into a gorgeous deep relaxation!Beautiful Gobinday ChantEasy pose with palms over each other at sternum level. To energise our lives! Really uplifting! I totally enjoyed this.Closing Prayer and Tune out via mantra 'Sat Nam' to end the Class.There is an extra option for you that you can add into the class before ending class with the 'Closing Prayer and Tune out' and that is the'Purify your Past' meditation:Easy pose, palms together and base of palms in contact with the navel througout - moving the palms up and down quite quickly.Wow...bliss, energy, calm, radiance............transformed! yes!Ana and Ravi give clear instruction and encourage you throughout as well as giving additional information about the benefits of doing this amazing class. Ana demonstrates beautifully. I am so comfortable with their way of teaching which I find to be gentle and inspiring. This DVD is a favourite and I will be rotating it often throughout my practice in the week.Thanks to Ana and Ravi for producing such wonderful DVD classes.Sat Nam x

reviewText: This dvd follows the usual format of all the Raviana dvd offerings, making the experience like just moving from one session to another.  Inside are familiar "exercises" and variations on familiar ones from other dvds as well as new ones and new music. I also have 12 others and although for right now, I believe this one is my favorite of them all, that changes as I rotate through all of them.  They are all grand, in my opinion, and I am grateful to have found them and the Kundalini practice.I have read comments about the background on the last six dvds, and I will say that at first I did not really care for it, personally, but in no time at all, I had forgotten about the background and just focused on the experience. Some reviews mentioned that sounds were muffled and Ravi difficult to hear, but I have not found that to be the case.

reviewText: I like to work out hard and, even when I practice yoga. I want to challenge myself and grow. The only yoga that gets me there is Kundalini Yoga, especially Ana & Ravi's style because they always are sure to give you a well rounded total body workout no matter which of their titles you get.In fact, due to them, Yoga has become my main form of fitness these days.This workout is one of their most exhilirating!!!! I still actually sweat and shake just like some other reviewers mentioned but WOW I feel amazing afterward like my whole body is smiling! I felt transformed from the very first time. I always expect my body to be aching the next day after I first tried this but no, I think all the breathing moves the lactic acid along so no soreness just results. Absolutely phenonomal workout - get it (no matter what your level )- you will be hooked! P.S. I especially love the arm exercises done in a kind of horse stance: an amazoning whole body experience.
summary: Challenging but doable (and easy to follow) Yoga Workout
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is my fifth DVD from Ravi and Ana, but it's the first one I've bought from the new series that they've put out from 2009-2010.  I almost didn't buy it because I've seen so many negative comments about the new look of these more recent workouts.  I actually love the new backdrop; yes, it's fake, but it's so bright and cheerful to look at, and I enjoy looking at it.  Ana also looks as radiant as always, and she brings her usual grace to this new workout.I've had this DVD for a few months now, but wanted to wait to write a review so I could use it more and comment on it.  Several other people have broken down the various sequences, so I will just add that the Matrix and Premix options are great, as usual.  There are five premixes, ranging from 35 minutes to 60 minutes, so you can fit in some transformative yoga even when you have little time.The Gobinday chant is one of the highlights of this DVD for me.  The first time doing it, I felt a little silly, but now I look forward to it and the lovely feeling it imparts.I also wanted to add that this DVD doesn't feel quite as strenuous to me as some of their other videos. If you're looking for more of a "workout" video, then perhaps you could try their Fat Free Yoga or Kundalini Yoga for Beginners. This one, however, really does energize me and fill me with positive energy, which was exactly what I was hoping it would do!
summary: Another blissful DVD from Ravi and Ana
Title: N/A

reviewText: TRANSFORMER works the places we store grief, among other sticky emotions. It starts out working the shoulders, takes you into release of the solar plexus, and ends with a "bonfire" in the abs to burn away your past -- freeing you up to move forward.I LOVE this DVD. It is an essential part of my growing Raviana DVD library :) Without it, I might still be harboring resentment about times in the past when I felt powerless, or grieving over failed relationships. This is healing to the max!Not only do I feel unburdened now, but my sense of the future has greatly EXPANDED. Unheard-of goodness is popping up all over my life!Thank you, Ravi and Ana.
Title: N/A

reviewText: What a lovely new gift from Ana and Ravi!I have been practicing Kundalini Yoga daily as taught by Ravi and Ana for several years and think all their DVDs are wonderful - and this one is certainly no exception.As mentioned in the description, it contains KY warm-ups, Two Transformer Sets, a very powerful set called Born Free, Deep Relaxation, a Beautiful Gobinday Chant and then a surprise - a more powerful yet Purify Your Past Set.The warm-ups include traditional exercises we learned in other Ana and Ravi's DVDs - stomach grinds, spinal flexes, twists, rag doll, etc - all very pleasant.The Transformer 1 and Transformer 2 sets include exercise that work both emotional and physical, some are done standing, some sitting, some lying down - movements include second position plie squats with arm and breath movements (modifications are offered), navel center exercises (leg lifts and a modification of a stretch pose), etc. I really like the commentary - Ana and Ravi explain how these movements work on both physical and emotional levels.Then comes the Born Free part with two exercises, both with the same breath pattern - inhale through puckered lips, exhale through the nose - the first one designed to evoke and transform inner anger (and it's also excellent for the lymphatic system) and the second one to help one be focused and fearless.Nice long Deep Relaxation follows, and then we do the beautiful Gobinday chant.The main workout seems to end there - credits follow, then the breath primer - and then another set came on - Purify Your Past. The exercises in this set were definitely challenging and I think really powerful. They are designed to get rid of holding patterns in the past and "everything we no longer need" (on a physical level they'll make your shoulders and upper body stronger than any number of push-ups).The set is the same as in the latest 3 DVD releases - beach scene, blue skies, lush greens.The music is very pleasant - some instrumental, some vocals - I am not an expert, but one would probably describe some of it as tribal, some traditional Indian. I miss Ana's signing.The narration is wonderful! Ana's demonstrations are impeccable, she looks beautiful and radiant as always, and Ravi's commentary made me feel absolutely blissful not even 15 minutes into the workout.I think the DVD is very doable for all levels, even if some of the longer performed exercises require a little practice.  Can't recommend it enough.Thank you so much, Ana and Ravi, for such a wonderful new gift of Kundalini Yoga!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I started my Kundalini Yoga journey with these Author's Kundalini Yoga for Beginners & Beyond. I've since gone on to buy many more of their titles. K.Y. Transformer is an incredible workout. Upper and lower body get equal strengthening and stretching. Abs too. The underside of my upper arms has always been a problem and I swear that this tape has firmed that area better than any free weight class I've taken or innumerable dips on chairs. But I don't want to seem shallow. What's great about this goes way beyond upper arm toning. This journey takes you deep and deeper to really get in there and turn negative emotions from the past into real joy. There's no way to describe it. You jut have to do it and experience it for yourself!

reviewText: Even if you are new to Kundalini yoga this Kundalini Yoga workout is not too difficult to do and it's so very energizing! I have been doing Ana & Ravis workouts for about 6 years now and I am in love with every new one they come out with. Solar Power is  simply fabulous (great navel workout) and I love this one too! These 2 are my new favorites! I hesitate to say this to scare people away but the very first time I did this I was brought to tears during the relaxation after the "Born Again" sequence. I truly do feel light and fresh and born again each time I do this workout. Please be aware you can use the matrix to customize your workout and you can do either the Born Again or Purify Your Past segement. No need to do both. Some people complain about the new look and set - I love it. Why do people resist change? Ana & Ravi are artists and teach us to be our creative selves - why shouldn't they? Please keep putting out your great workouts Ana & Ravi & I will keep buying them!
summary: A real Kundalini Yoga workout that truly will transform you!

reviewText: Sat NamWhere to start with this piece of tripe I mean DVD. One, there is NOTHING on this DVD that you can't find on youtube from REAL Yogis for free! This is an overly commercialized dvd. Ravi talks as though he is talking to a 5 yr old! I felt like this was Kundalini time on Sesame Street! The matrix does not work, the music is horrid. Ana looks so incredibly fake doing the exercises. Sacred Kriyas have been reduced to kindergarten style songs. Kundalini yoga is a VERY serious ancient practice and nothing to trivialized for profit as Ravi and Ana have done. Do yourself a favor. Go to Youtube and look up Yogi Bhajan, Guruhk 333 or some of the other REAL yogis and learn from them...for free! I am going to be reselling my copy of this DVD on ebay!
summary: The Sesame Street of Yoga! An Insult to an Ancient Art!
Title: N/A

reviewText: You can only begin to transform if you learn to let go of your negative emotions. many women store their negative emotion in their shoulders and solar plexus: this kundalini dvd really works in these areas through meditative moves and breath work.  Dont be deceived by some of the meditative moves as I was working up a sweat to keep going and to hold the position!  I felt great after an hour of a matrix combination, as I usually do; great mentally, physically and physically.  For those new to kundalini and to Ravi and Ana, please watch the breath primer as this is such an important integral part of kundalini yoga and finish any matrix work out with the relaxation, chant and closing prayer: all my favorite parts to complete my yoga moment.  As always, the instructions always provides alternative positions for those who are a stiffer than Ana, like me.I loved this dvd to work on my stiff upper back and shoulders (lots of stored negative energy) and I certainly felt lighter afterwards once the emotions were released.  Haha, you may find that you are replaying those negative scenes as you work through the program: this is not untypical!  I had to force my mind back onto the yoga and try to keep my mind still.  Lovely to see my own transformation as I am working through the program. When I am working on the section: transform yourpast, the release of the tension in my shoulders is through a huuuuuuge yawn/mouth stretch!  No kidding, the release was palatable and boy did it feel good.This new dvd has many of my favorites parts and three  new routines and moves with the usual great explanation of what each move provides.  Thank you for printing the lyrics for the chant!!  I LOVE the great experiences and benefits that I get from Ravi and Ana's teachings: so blessed to have another great teaching dvd to choose from my growing Ravi and Ana collections in my daily spiritual journey.Great for beginners and especially if you know you have emotional issues to deal with.  I also recommend the yoga cleanse as this helps to clean out toxins in your organs that are also created from stress.
summary: Works on the negative tension build up in the shoulders
Title: N/A

reviewText: This review will have a two-part format. In the first part, I'll describe the contents of the DVD as well as my thoughts on them. In the second part, I'll say some more general things about Ana and Ravi and kundalini yoga. It seems the negative reviews of their DVDs come mainly from people who didn't know what to expect when ordering kundalini yoga DVDs -- because they ARE a little bit different from what you're used to, if you've only practiced hatha yoga in the past. I am unabashedly an Ana and Ravi fan, but hopefully my evaluation will help you make the correct decision for yourself, even if your opinion happens not to be the same as mine.----------Part I----------Like most of Ana and Ravi's DVDs, Kundalini Yoga Transformer All-In-One Workout has the matrix menu, which allows you to customize the length of your workout.Introduction (1:20): Sometimes the introduction is necessary to understanding the goal of Ana’s and Ravi’s DVDs.  I don’t really think you need to bother with it this time, unless you want to.  They go into detail during the yoga sets, themselves, about the purposes of the exercises.Tune In (2:00): This segment is similar/the same in many of Ana's and Ravi's DVDs; you sit cross-legged, focus on your breathing, and chant "ong namo guru dev namo" three times.Warm-Ups (10:00): This is a rather long warm-up for one of Ana’s and Ravi’s DVDs.  I happen to think it’s great, especially for working out kinks in the back and legs (helpful early in the morning, especially).  Some of these exercises appear in Ana’s and Ravi’s Cardio, Stretch, and Strengthen DVD, as well.  This segment consists of the following exercises.*While seated, grind your stomach in circles*Hold your shins and flex your spine back and forth*Hold your knees and flex your spine back and forth*Seated with your legs crossed, have your arms at right angles; inhale and move your arms back and apart; exhale and move your arms forward to where your forearms meet; flex your spine to go with the arm movements*With your arms at right angles, twist left and right*Sit with your legs in front of you, bring one foot to the opposite thigh, lean forward over the extended leg, then switch*Static stretch with one foot at the opposite thigh and your upper body/arms extended out over the straight leg*Relax on your backTransformer Part 1 (9:30): This segment consists of the following exercises.*In a deep plié with your heels raised, curl your fingers and extend your thumbs and have your arms parallel to the ground; point your thumbs forward, up, back, and up again to the rhythm of the breath of fire*With your legs in the previous position and your thumbs extended again, bring your thumbs to your shoulders and then extend your arms to the sides, parallel to the ground*Seated, hold your knees; elongate your neck, then press your face forward while your spine pushes back*With your hands on your shoulders, fingers in front, move your arms out, then bring your hands back in, then lift your elbows, then come back to the original position; intone “har” with each movement*Relax on your backTransformer Part 2 (8:00): This segment consists of the following exercises.*With your hands under you for support, raise your heels six inches off the ground*Cross your ankles and do double leg lifts*Lie down with your arms up at 90 degrees, do sit ups*Sit with your knees bent; push up into table and then come back down*Stay in table, tilt your head back, and do two different breath patterns with your mouth open*Seated, interlace your hands overhead with your thumbtips together and pointed back; do long deep breathingBorn Free (16:30): I can’t finish this one without a break.  Be forewarned that it will be quite tough for most people.  I tried to go a little longer each time, to work my way up to finishing the entire set.  This segment consists of the following exercises.*Seated, with your hands in rigid claws and your arms bent at the elbows, circle your hands at temple level (about 10 minutes); inhale through puckered lips and exhale through your nose*With the same breath pattern, interlace your hands overhead with your arms roundedThere are some visualizations in this section.  While you ARE moving or holding a static pose the whole time, this is really more of a meditative section.Deep Relaxation (4:22): This is similar in many of Ravi's and Ana's DVDs. Lie on your back, slow your breathing, and listen.  There’s a gong in part of this, and I like it a lot better than in the Solar Power DVD.  But, there are some drums in the background that I find distracting because I don’t think they really work with the gong.  (Maybe that’s just me, though?)Beautiful Gobinday Chant (5:50): This is pretty simple, you just repeat the mantra listed below.Gobinday MukundayUdaray UparayHariang KariangNearnamay AkamayThe mantra is fine, but I don't care for the instrumental accompaniment in this one. I like the melody but not the synthesizer beat so much.Closing Prayer (1:11): This is similar to what appears in other Ravi/Ana DVDs.  However, it’s a bit shorter.Breath Primer: Please note that this segment may not play if you just play the entire DVD through. It is accessible from the matrix menu and the chapter selection menu, however. If you are not familiar with kundalini yoga, you will definitely want to follow along here. It's actually a pretty good refresher for anyone who has practiced for awhile, as well. You learn how to do long deep breathing, a panting breath that serves as an introduction to breath of fire, and then a standard breath of fire technique. I think this is the exact same segment as was included with some of Ana's and Ravi's other "blonde Ana" DVDs.Purify Your Past (9:30): This is another meditative segment, though there are some changing hand/arm positions.*With your hands in prayer position and the heels of your hands at your navel, move your hands up and down against your abdomen*Hold your arms out to the sides (parallel to the ground) and do breath of fire*Tilt your head back, keep your arms out at the sides, and do long deep breathing through an open mouth*Bring your head back to a normal position, do long deep breathingThis segment is about transforming emotions and there are some visualizations involved.  It appears after the credits but you can easily program it to be wherever you want using the Matrix Menu.For those of you familiar with Ravi's and Ana's DVDs, this is one of the newer ones with the concrete floor, white pillars, fake nature background, and blonde Ana. Both Ravi and Ana narrate and Ana demonstrates the poses and movements. The music is all over the place here.  There’s a slow song that’s mostly a woman’s vocals that pops up in Transformer Part 2 and some of the other segments and I absolutely love that.  Then there’s also some music that reminds me of Ana’s and Ravi’s older DVDs (the ones where Ana’s hair is dark).  Most of the music is stuff I like, though, unless I have made special note of not liking it elsewhere in this review.I don't care for the camera work in certain parts of this. It seems to jump around randomly, and sometimes there are zooms in and out between camera angles that are jarring. Also, at the beginning of the cardio segment, there are some odd light/strobe like effects that I don't care for. Maybe it's just me, but I'd prefer standard (boring) camera work where you can always see what Ana's doing, with no unnecessary visual effects.If you have problems with your wrists, please be careful in Transformer Part 2.  The part where you lift up into table and then hold table can be tough and you might not want to do it every day.  Alternate with other segments/other DVDs if you are worried about your wrists.  There aren’t really any moves in this one that require modifications (you can do the pliés with your heels on the ground if you need to).  However, in Born Free and Purify Your Past, you might have to take breaks.  Those segments are killer on the upper arms.I feel like parts of this DVD would work for beginners and parts would not. The warm-ups are quite good and the first two (physical) yoga sets are not too strenuous (other than the possible wrist issues in Transformer Part 2 that I mentioned above).  Finally, don't forget -- you don't have to keep up with Ana, nor do you have to stretch as far forward as Ana in the forward-bending moves. Work at your own pace and do what YOU can.----------Part II----------Now, on to a more general discussion of kundalini yoga in general, and Ana's and Ravi's DVDs in particular. (I intend to include a version of this in all my reviews of Ana's and Ravi's DVDs.)Most of the yoga that people are familiar with falls under the umbrella of hatha yoga. Perhaps you've done a series of static poses, or some vinyasa/flow yoga. Kundalini yoga is not exactly like either of these, although Ana's and Ravi's DVDs do incorporate elements of hatha yoga (e.g., this DVD has table pose in it). However, kundalini yoga is also what I would consider to be a very active form of yoga, consisting of some repeated movements and a lot more work with the breath than you may be used to. It can be difficult to keep up with at first, but can be very rewarding if you stick with it. If you are bored of holding static poses all the time, or if you want a bit more movement but hate vinyasa (sorry, but I am not a fan of flow yoga), kundalini might really work well for you. And, as I said earlier, use the modifications Ana and Ravi discuss if you need to use them. Yes, Ana is fit (and this makes her an excellent demonstrator for the poses), but this is not a competition. Don't strain yourself, and don't try to keep up with her. Just try to improve a little bit every time!Kundalini yoga also involves a lot of meditation. Sometimes this is quiet and involves breathing either in a sitting position or lying down, occasionally with your hands in a mudra (hand position). Sometimes it involves chanting a mantra. This DVD contains a mantra chanting segment as well as the Born Free and Purify Your Past segments; these last two do not involve chanting but do involve visualizations. Whenever there are mantras, Ana and Ravi tell you what they mean. If you are uncomfortable with mantras for religious reasons, check out Ana's and Ravi's website (can't post links in reviews but they're easy to find through Google) for alternatives and use the matrix menu or your DVD remote to skip the chants. (I happen to like the chants, but that's just me.)With respect to calorie-burning, this DVD is probably not going to do a ton. But kundalini yoga works on your inner self as well as your outer self, and so some parts are a little less "active" than others. For my own part, I still do plenty of pretty intense cardio at other times of the day. (I do about 30 minutes of yoga a day by combining segments using the matrix menu. Ana and Ravi are a part of my fitness routine, but they are not the whole of it.)Ana's outfits are a bit skimpy, but certainly nothing less than you would see at the beach. And the reason she dresses like she does is so that you can really see her performing the movements and asanas. That way you know exactly how to position yourself for maximum benefit. (Most of the time, kundalini yoga is done with the eyes closed, anyway.) There is a lot in the way of initial instruction in this DVD in the extra segments. If you are familiar with Ana's and Ravi's work, you can jump right in. But if you are new to kundalini yoga, watch it first. Observe Ana, listen to the cues, make sure you understand. You'll be glad for the ability to omit the instructional segments later -- you don't want to be told on the 20th time you do a DVD how to do table; you know it by this point!A few health claims are made in this DVD. Take those that do appear with a grain of salt. I do find that Ana and Ravi are quite accurate when it comes to muscular and skeletal issues. At any rate, certainly don't use yoga as a substitute for seeing the doctor. But doing a routine like this isn't likely to hurt you or make your health condition worse (as long as you PACE YOURSELF).If you are struggling with a sequence, Ravi and Ana are very accessible and quite nice. They have contact information on their website (the URL is on the DVD case) and usually get back to you in a couple of days. They also have a monthly e-mail newsletter that I enjoy.

reviewText: I have had my share of therapy in my life but I've never encountered anything which so directly takes you deep inside and changes you. This is really quite genius. It's a workout but so much more. Emotions can work for us or against us. This DVD will give you the ability to turn your emotions into forward motion!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a long time fan of the raviana series of DVDs. And I have to thank them for helping me lose a lot of weight. Transformer Workout is seriously good stuff!!!!!!!!!  A very interesting workout that has all the great stretching and strengthening and core work, etc, we fans have come to love from these two yogis. But then you do a rebirthing technique called Born Free or you can substitute it with Purify Your Past. And WOW! I felt like I really seriously let go of some heavy baggage, tension, and inertia after just one doing! Makes me believe in magic again. So many amazing things are happening. I recommend choosing one of the techniques and doing it 7 days. Very powerful!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have a fair number of Ana and Ravi's DVDs (as do most reviewers, I noticed) and this one (along with Solar Power) became an instant favorite!This workout has a lot of variety in the poses and also because it works on your energy on multiple levels, not just the physical. It's a good one to choose when you're feeling frustrated or stuck in some area of your life. It's peaceful and powerful at the same time!I always feel a great release in my upper back and shoulders after this one! Give it a try and lighten your load!
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Trish "A Sun Salutin', Crochet Hookin' Chick!"
reviewText: Other reviewers( Lucie) have so brilliantly described the contents and lengths of each section that I can't improve, so I'll go on.What I enjoyed about this DVD is what I enjoy about all of the Ravi/Ana DVD's.  I like the positive speech.  In this DVD particularly, you are encouraged to be a better you.  You are great now, but you can be even better.  I think that the general population needs to know this because of all of the negative speech we're hammered with daily from the media, family, etc.I also felt like this DVD gave me tools to use to "purge" (for lack of a better word) the past negatives in my life and focus on the present.  Purify your Past was most favorite segment of the DVD.  The physical actions are difficult for me, but I translate that to the working through past mental/emotional pains and when the physical pains is gone, so is the past mental/emotional pain.  I plan to use this segment frequently, even if I only do the one segment.I, as always, appreciate the ability to manage my time by only practicing segments time allows for on that day.  The matrix options on the Ana/Ravi DVD's are still my favorites of all DVD's.The music is beautiful, the cueing is great, the reasoning for the asana is appreciated...over all a great DVD practice.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Have been this workout for a few days now. What can I say - another awesome workout from Ana Brett & Ravi Singh. This harkens back to their more old school workouts. Your arms will tremble during the Born Free segment but so what? You will feel fresh and new and your shoulders and arms will rock tanktops this summer LOL!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I own several of the Ravi and Ana Dvd's and this is definitely not one of my favorites. I was hoping for something more out of this from the description. The warm up sequences and transformer sequences are both relaxing and meditative and do some good work on your navel center. The "born free" segment is what really kills it for me. There is one moving meditation that is performed for 11 minutes (I believe) and the arm movements absolutely kill my neck and shoulders. I believe I can do this one for 3 minutes, I hope I still get some of the benefits. I realize these type of long poses are standard in kundalini yoga, but do we really need a dvd segment to lead us through this sequence? You could easily find it for free on the internet and do it on your own.The gobinda mukunday mantra on this dvd is weird too, there's other recordings that are so much better like Sada Sat Kaur and Gurunam Singh to name a few. The recording here just sounds childlike and creepy.I'm not sure I will keep this dvd, I have several kundalini programs now that I enjoy so much more and that don't hurt my neck. I might do the warm up and transformer segments on a day when I don't feel like anything too taxing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Sometimes there are kundalini yoga sets that are more spiritual than physical.  This dvd contains those kind of sets.  I wouldn't categorize this dvd as a body workout but a spiritual workout. The transformer part 2/born free set is also a set that was done on an old Ravi video tape with wife #1. Just thought I'd share that for all of you old timers who may think that the description of the exercises sound familiar. I'm glad that they put the set on dvd, however I wish the transformer exercises were longer as they were on the vhs.  Just when I was getting into the moves, they were over.  Anyway, I really don't have much to add that others have not already said. The vocal music by Sat Kartar Kaur Khalsa was wonderful! The born free and purify your past sets were physically and mentally challenging and are authentic kundalini practices that challenge your will to keep up.  One reviewer was disappointed because this dvd didn't have active sets. OK, but not all kundalini sets are physically active.  You won't sweat up a storm here, but your shoulders will burn and hopefully you'll release a lot of baggage.  Ravi suggests that you do the purify your past set for 7 days straight.  I plan on following that prescription.
Title: N/A
